alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Rush and southeastern Henry Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rushville, or 17 miles west of Connersville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Rush and southeastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Glenwood, Mays, Straughn and Lewisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 128 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and east central Indiana.
